Text: INT. CONCERT HALL - NIGHT

On stage, ROBETRO (60s), a renowed pianist with sliver hair and expresive eyes, is playing a pasionate piece of music on the grand piano. The audience watches in awe.

Suddenly, Roberto wicnes in pain. His hands freze over the keys. He tries to continue but colapses onto the piano. Gasps echo through the hall as the curtain quickly falls.

FADE TO:

EXT. CITY PARK - DAY

Roberto, now with a cast on his right hand, sits alone on a park bench, staring blankly at a group of children playing nearby.

A YOUNG BOY (10), scruffy and full of life, aproaches him carrying an old, beaten-up keyboard under his arm. He recognises Roberto.

YOUNG BOY
You're Roberto! I've seen you on TV!

Roberto forces a smile.

ROBERTO
Yes, I am. What's your name?

YOUNG BOY
I'm Danny. I want to play like you one day.

Danny places his keyboard on the bench and starts clumsily playing a familiar tune. Roberto listens attentively, his interest piqued.

CUT TO:

INT. ROBERTO'S APARTMENT - DAY

Roberto sits at his grand piano, watching as Danny struggles to replicate the melody he played earlier. 

Roberto reaches out with his left hand and corrects Danny's position on the keys. For the first time since his accident, Roberto smiles genuinely.

FADE OUT:

TO BE CONTINUED...
